string-array.name: resource_1353
string-array.item:
"The receipt of the foreign currency is made at all Bank Hapoalim counters at Terminals 3 and 1 at Ben Gurion Airport. A passport or ID number of the foreign currency recipient must be provided, as indicated in the reservation. (On the bank\'s website, at workers\' by phone or at the branch.) Foreign currency that is not collected on time - will be kept for up to 4 business days from the flight date specified in the reservation. After that, it will be deposited back into the account purchased.
The Bank will be entitled not to place the order in any case of legal impediment or collection of a collection procedure by the Bank. Cancellation of the order made at the immediate rate / order / known on the same business day - will be possible without debiting the account. In the event of cancellation of an order made at the exchange rate in an order / known not on the same business day - the foreign currency will be deposited back into the account from which it was purchased, in accordance with the cash exchange rate (purchase) on the day of cancellation. "

"The receipt of the foreign currency is made at all Bank Hapoalim counters at Terminals 3 and 1 at Ben Gurion Airport. A passport or ID number of the foreign currency recipient must be provided, as indicated in the reservation. (On the bank\'s website, at workers\' by phone or at the branch.) Foreign currency that is not collected on time - will be kept for up to 4 business days from the flight date specified in the reservation. After that, it will be deposited back into the account purchased.
The Bank will be entitled not to place the order in any case of legal impediment or collection of a collection procedure by the Bank. Cancellation of the order made at the immediate rate / order / known on the same business day - will be possible without debiting the account. In the event of cancellation of an order made at the exchange rate in an order / known not on the same business day - the foreign currency will be deposited back into the account from which it was purchased, in accordance with the cash exchange rate (purchase) on the day of cancellation. "

string-array.name: resource_1932
string-array.item:
"The calculation is based on current bank records and includes current account balance and future NIS loans from deposits and savings (for which a withdrawal order was issued), checks deposited, standing orders and credit. Cards (according to the information received by the bank before settlement), from interest payments, principal and dividends in the company (according to information received from the bank before the settlement date), and from the sale of the future foreign currency (calculated amount according to the transfer / check exchange rate known from last business day).
The calculation also includes future shekel credit card debits (as per information obtained from the bank prior to settlement date), checks issued and deposited with Bank Hapoalim, instructions for deposits and savings, standing debit fees, unavoidable loan fees, mortgage fees (in accordance with the last debit amount), fees for the purchase of foreign currency and commissions for future foreign exchange transactions (calculated amount in accordance with the transfer / check rate known from the last business day).
Only loans and payments scheduled from today to the end of the month are included in the calculation if the bank is known and registered in its systems in a computerized manner. The calculation does not guarantee the actual crediting of the account and is not evidence of the bank\'s consent to pay the commission. The crediting of the account depends, among other things, on the payment of the checks deposited in safekeeping and on the cancellation of the credit instructions. Payment of account fees will be subject to the availability of sufficient balance as stated in all agreements between the bank and the client, as well as in accordance with the provisions of the law."

"The calculation is based on current bank records and includes current account balance and future NIS loans from deposits and savings (for which a withdrawal order was issued), checks deposited, standing orders and credit. Cards (according to the information received by the bank before settlement), from interest payments, principal and dividends in the company (according to information received from the bank before the settlement date), and from the sale of the future foreign currency (calculated amount according to the transfer / check exchange rate known from last business day).
The calculation also includes future shekel credit card debits (as per information obtained from the bank prior to settlement date), checks issued and deposited with Bank Hapoalim, instructions for deposits and savings, standing debit fees, unavoidable loan fees, mortgage fees (in accordance with the last debit amount), fees for the purchase of foreign currency and commissions for future foreign exchange transactions (calculated amount in accordance with the transfer / check rate known from the last business day).
Only loans and payments scheduled from today to the end of the month are included in the calculation if the bank is known and registered in its systems in a computerized manner. The calculation does not guarantee the actual crediting of the account and is not evidence of the bank\'s consent to pay the commission. The crediting of the account depends, among other things, on the payment of the checks deposited in safekeeping and on the cancellation of the credit instructions. Payment of account fees will be subject to the availability of sufficient balance as stated in all agreements between the bank and the client, as well as in accordance with the provisions of the law."
